channel.title: Android Police – Android news, reviews, apps, games, phones, tablets

item.title: Netflix gets new Chromecast UI with content recommendations and more
item.dc:creator: Ryne Hager
item.description:
It's better than just staring at a static logo

When you get home from work and fire up Netflix on the Chromecast tonight, you might notice that something's a bit different today. The company is rolling out a new, and much more attractive interface for the entire Netflix-on-Chromecast experience, including a revamped ambient "Ready to Cast" screen and some tweaks to the loading screen and pause screen.

The "Ready to Cast" screen that shows once you connect the app to your Chromecast has a dramatically updated look.

Read More

Netflix gets new Chromecast UI with content recommendations and more was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Laptop-phone Cosmo Communicator hits 350% of crowdfunding goal (Update: Linux support)
item.dc:creator: Ryne Hager
item.description:
• Update 1: 2020/02/26 3:19pm PST
    One of the selling points for the Cosmo Communicator was the promise of dual-boot Linux support, and now the Linux system image is available to try out. The installation process

A bit over a week ago, an Android phone with a PDA/laptop form-factor called the Cosmo Communicator hit Indiegogo. I know, I know, crowdfund projects are whatever, but the Cosmo has two interesting things going for it: the company behind it (Planet Computers) already has one similar success under its belt, and the project is already over 350% funded with three weeks left to go.

Read More

Laptop-phone Cosmo Communicator hits 350% of crowdfunding goal (Update: Linux support) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Microsoft Outlook adds annotation feature for photos and scanned documents
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description:
Scribble on your photos without leaving your email app

Outlook is one of the most popular third-party email apps on Android, and it keeps getting better. Only a few months after rolling out dark mode support and POP3 integration, the app has added the ability to annotate photos and documents ⁠using your phone's camera.

While composing an email, you can tap on the camera button to take a photo or scan a document. That functionality isn't new, but what is new is that you can now draw on top of images.

Read More

Microsoft Outlook adds annotation feature for photos and scanned documents was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Snag a Samsung Chromebook 4 15" for $232 ($88 off) at Amazon
item.dc:creator: Zach Laidlaw
item.description:
There are many reasons to prefer Chrome OS over other operating systems. It's lightweight, always up to date, and isn't susceptible to traditional viruses. If you've been curious about trying out a Chromebook to replace your current computer, serve as a second computer, or even be your only computer, you should definitely check out this Samsung Chromebook 4 15" for $232.49 ($87.50 off) at Amazon.

Samsung is known for building quality hardware, and the Chromebook 4 15" is no different.

Read More

Snag a Samsung Chromebook 4 15" for $232 ($88 off) at Amazon was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Ad-free news subscription Scroll now hides unsightly toolbar by default (Update: Dark mode too)
item.dc:creator: Zach Laidlaw
item.description:
Android Police just keeps getting better
  • Update 1: 2020/02/26 2:18pm PST
    After we rolled out our dark theme earlier this month, many of you asked when the Scroll bar would match the theme. You'll be glad to hear that Scroll

If you haven't heard of Scroll by now (where have you been?), it's this nifty service that removes ads from 300 of your favorite news sites, including Android Police. Although the service is quite young, its developers have been quick to implement changes that readers have been begging for.

Read More

Ad-free news subscription Scroll now hides unsightly toolbar by default (Update: Dark mode too) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Google Image Search results will stop highlighting picture dimensions in favor of new labels and licensing details
item.dc:creator: Jules Wang
item.description:
Those labels tell you what type of content will be on the website the image is on

If you're using Google Image Search in any serious capacity — say, to fill a slideshow up with helpful, relevant visual media — then you may be somewhat concerned with the dimensions of the pictures you're finding (that is, how well a picture will blow up). However, the search engine company will soon deprioritize this information in favor of showing you other parameters.

The Google SearchLiaison Twitter account has posted that Image Search will begin emphasizing the content that's associated with the images in search results through small icons — recipes, videos, blog posts, or even media available for licensing.

Read More

Google Image Search results will stop highlighting picture dimensions in favor of new labels and licensing details was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Google Translate is adding five new languages, including Uyghur and Turkmen
item.dc:creator: Zach Laidlaw
item.description:
Google can now translate 108 languages across the web

Just a day after we noticed that Google Translate will soon be able to save translation history to Google accounts, the service is back in the news. This time, the Google Translate team has announced that five new languages — Kinyarwanda, Odia (Oriya), Tatar, Turkmen, and Uyghur — are coming to its growing library.

According to Google, languages like these that haven't been utilized often across the web are particularly difficult for its  platform to study and decipher.

Read More

Google Translate is adding five new languages, including Uyghur and Turkmen was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Treat your ears to a pair of refurbished Samsung Galaxy Buds for $55 ($75 off)
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kerns
item.description:
A great deal on great earbuds

Samsung's Galaxy Buds+ might be the new true wireless hotness, but the original model is still really great, with decent battery life, pleasing sound quality, and a sleek, pocketable case. And if you're on the hunt for a pair of good, cheap wireless earbuds, this deal definitely fits the bill: you can get a refurbished set of Galaxy Buds for $55 at Best Buy.

Scott was a fan of the Galaxy Buds when he reviewed them last year: "They probably aren’t the best at anything," he wrote, "but they do everything pretty well." That's true at their MSRP, and it's absolutely true at more than half off.

Read More

Treat your ears to a pair of refurbished Samsung Galaxy Buds for $55 ($75 off) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Leaked Surface Duo demo videos show off 'peeking' notifications UI
item.dc:creator: Jules Wang
item.description:
It's an open-and-shut case of software design

When it comes to the software on smartphones with folding displays (or, at least, a display field that can close in on itself), manufacturers are still out there trying to figure out the usability picture. Microsoft is faced with that very challenge right now as it continues developing its Android-powered dual-screen mobile device, the Surface Duo — and we might have just gotten a peek at a trick up its sleeve.

Read More

Leaked Surface Duo demo videos show off 'peeking' notifications UI was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Prepare for warmer weather with this Rachio smart sprinkler controller for just $120
item.dc:creator: Zach Laidlaw
item.description:
Spring and summer are on the way

It's going to be getting warm soon in the northern hemisphere, and along with a new season will come plenty of opportunities for heat and maybe even droughts to ravage your lawn. To help keep your yard looking healthy while also cutting down on watering costs, check out the Rachio Pro Edition Smart Sprinkler controller for just $119.99 ($110 off) at Woot.

This Rachio smart sprinkler controller is a connected solution built to wield your existing sprinkler system in up to 16 different zones.

Read More

Prepare for warmer weather with this Rachio smart sprinkler controller for just $120 was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: 17 temporarily free and 27 on-sale apps and games for Wednesday
item.dc:creator: Matthew Sholtz
item.description:
Welcome to Wednesday, everyone. It's the middle of the week, and so this is a slower time for sales, but that doesn't mean I don't have a few standouts to share today. So if you're looking for a solid puzzler, Mirage: Illusions is completely free today, and if you enjoy spooky adventure games, then Distraint 2 is a solid pickup at more than half-off. As always, I've highlighted the interesting titles in bold to make discovery easier.

Read More

17 temporarily free and 27 on-sale apps and games for Wednesday was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Amazon's Fire tablets are slow, but you can (probably) make them faster
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description:
Amazon's Fire tablets are incredibly popular for one reason: they are cheaper than most of the competition. The catch is that most models compromise on performance to an extreme degree, typically with low-power processors and a shortage of memory. Most mobile applications, especially games, don't fare as well on Fire tablets as they do on modern smartphones.

However, there are a few ways you can speed up a Fire tablet. We're not miracle workers, and these steps won't turn your tablet into a high-end device, but there's a good chance you'll see a noticeable difference in performance afterwards.

Read More

Amazon's Fire tablets are slow, but you can (probably) make them faster was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Amazon Cloud Cam down to new all-time low of $60 (half off) at Woot right now
item.dc:creator: Jules Wang
item.description:
Pay a little to get a security camera that does a lot

If today's the day you're thinking of picking up a security camera, you might want to click fast on this deal for the Amazon Cloud Cam. Woot has a one-day sale on at its lowest price yet.

The Cloud Cam has been a steady option since when we reviewed it in 2018 with all the typical features you'd want from a modern security camera: wide field of view, live watch capability, audio capture from an omnidirectional microphone, and motion-activated LED lighting at night.

Read More

Amazon Cloud Cam down to new all-time low of $60 (half off) at Woot right now was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Samsung Sound Assistant gets 2020 update, adds redesigned volume slider
item.dc:creator: Zachary Kew-Denniss
item.description:
Let's get vertical, vertical

Samsung started updating Good Lock, its one-stop-shop for customization, earlier this month to support Android 10. Notably absent was Sound Assistant, a tool offering in-depth tweaks to the system volume panel, as well as delving into the volume mixer to get things sounding just right. Today, Sound Assistant joins the rest of the Good Lock family with a new look and new features.

Left: Vertical volume slider, Middle: Sound panel, Right: Sound mixer

Most notable on the list of changes is what Samsung calls Sero, a theme that moves the volume slider to the side of the screen, matching the design stock Android switched to with Pie.

Read More

Samsung Sound Assistant gets 2020 update, adds redesigned volume slider was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Tubular deal: Get this Bluetooth-compatible vacuum tube amp and speaker set for just $60 ($220 off) (Update: Back in stock)
item.dc:creator: Garrett Bridges
item.description:
🤘
  • Update 1: 2020/02/25 10:32pm PST
    Sadly—but predictably—the speakers are now sold out on Target's site.
  • Update 2: 2020/02/26 8:59am PST
    Good news, everyone! Target's got more stock available, and that heavily discounted price is still around. Get 'em while you can.

Bluetooth speakers are a dime-a-dozen these days, but a true audio system that happens to include Bluetooth connectivity is something you don't see on the cheap very often.

Read More

Tubular deal: Get this Bluetooth-compatible vacuum tube amp and speaker set for just $60 ($220 off) (Update: Back in stock) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: LEGO Legacy: Heroes Unboxed is a F2P collect-a-thon RPG, now available on the Play Store (Update)
item.dc:creator: Matthew Sholtz
item.description:
• Update 1: 2020/02/26 8:31am PST
    LEGO Legacy: Heroes Unboxed is officially available

For some reason, LEGO has been busy this year lending out its brand to nefarious developers. Last week LEGO Star Wars Battles was announced, and it appears to be a free-to-play Clash Royale clone from Warner Bros. Today Gameloft's LEGO Legacy: Heroes Unboxed arrived on the Play Store for pre-registration, and it looks like a MARVEL Strike Force clone.

Read More

LEGO Legacy: Heroes Unboxed is a F2P collect-a-thon RPG, now available on the Play Store (Update) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Every new Android 11 feature we've spotted so far
item.dc:creator: Ryne Hager
item.description:
A short list for now, but expect it to get longer with later previews

It's that time of the year. Android 11 is here — or, at least, the first early developer previews are. We're continually combing through these new versions looking for changes, willing canaries in the Android coal mines so that you, our readers, can see what's new without having to actually risk installing it on your own phone (if you don't want to). Now that we've had some time to look around, here's everything new we've spotted.

Read More

Every new Android 11 feature we've spotted so far was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Verizon launches its own Android TV set-top box, called Stream TV (Update: Netflix and Prime Video support)
item.dc:creator: Cody English
item.description:
• Update 1: 2019/11/13 7:48am PST
    We've tossed a little asterisk (*) up with that claim of broad app and game support above, as some of the Stream TV's limitations come to light. Many of you
  • Update 2: 2020/02/26 8:00am PST
    Netflix and Prime video

Today, Verizon introduced its rumored Android TV-powered set-top box. The Verizon Stream TV is available to order directly from the company's site. Other than the signature red checkmark on top, the product is unbranded, and we haven't confirmed the manufacturer yet (though one source tells us it's very similar to Xiaomi's Mi Box).

Read More

Verizon launches its own Android TV set-top box, called Stream TV (Update: Netflix and Prime Video support) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Asus Chromebook Flip C436 preorders start at $800, making it the most expensive Flip yet (Update: Coming in April)
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description:
• Update 1: 2020/02/13 10:21am PST
    Product listings for the C436 were taken down shortly after they went live, leading some to speculate that they had gone live too early. Asus recently confirmed to Chrome
  • Update 2: 2020/02/26 7:52am PST
    New release date

Asus revealed its new flagship Chromebook at CES earlier this month, the Flip C436. Compared to the previous C434, it offers a thinner design, significant processor upgrades, and more storage.

Read More

Asus Chromebook Flip C436 preorders start at $800, making it the most expensive Flip yet (Update: Coming in April) was written by the awesome team at Android Police.

item.title: Plants vs. Zombies 3 leaves pre-alpha testing, enters soft launch in select territories
item.dc:creator: Matthew Sholtz
item.description:
EA hasn't released Plants vs. Zombies 3 just yet

Electronic Arts recently revealed that Plants vs. Zombies 3 has finally left its pre-alpha testing phase and has now entered into a soft-launch release cycle for select territories, and the Philippines is the first country to gain access. More countries will be added to the soft launch list in the future, though EA is still tight-lipped about any sort of expected time frame, and so the development of Plants vs. Zombies 3 will continue to trudge along during this technical testing phase.

Read More

Plants vs. Zombies 3 leaves pre-alpha testing, enters soft launch in select territories was written by the awesome team at Android Police.
